section.title: Placing an Order Above $100.00
section.para: This procedure describes how to to place an order above $100.00, and confirm the date and time for delivery.
Ensure Twinkle is correctly configured (), and idle, before proceeding.

step.para: Orders above $100.00 require the Store Manager to approve the order before the server will contact the customer.
Open two instances of the portal. In one portal instance, log in as the customer. The other portal must be logged on using the Store Manager account.

note.para: The Store Manager account details are on the portal home page.

step.para: Follow the procedure in , ensuring that the item (or items) selected total more than $100.00.
The order is now confirmed, and the Store Manager must approve the order before the server continues processing the transaction.

procedure.title: Approving The Order
procedure.para: The Site Manager must approve the order according to a Process Management workflow; the workflow selected determines how the customer is contacted.

step.para: In the Site Manager portal, the order is awaiting approval.

step.title: Select the Process Management workflow
step.para: Before approving the pending order, select ordermanagement2 in Admin Options and click Switch Order Process.

note.para: The ordermanagement2 workflow showcases the full process management functionality in the demonstration.

step.title: Escalate Order to Order Acceptance
step.para: Under the Task Assignment section, click Assign.
The customer order is moved from Task Assignment to Order Acceptance.

step.title: Review the Order
step.para: Under the Order Acceptance section, click Review.
The order acceptance screen is displayed. The screen provides details of the customer order and the opportunity for the Store Manager to Accept or Reject the order.

step.title: Accept the Order
step.para: The order is now accepted by the Store Manager, and the server calls the customer to set a delivery date and time.

step.title: Customer Specifies the Delivery Date and Time
step.para: Answer the incoming call and, when prompted, enter the date and time according to the format required by the server.

note.para: The format required for the date and time is ddmmyyhhmm. For example, if the preferred delivery date and time is 7th December 2009 at 1pm, the number sequence required is 0712091300.

step.para: Once the date and time has been correctly entered, the server will confirm the date and time entered and terminate the call.
The server then moves the order back to the Task Assignment phase of the workflow.

step.title: Escalate Order to Order Shipping
step.para: In the Task Assignment section of the Store Manager portal, click Assign.
The order moves to the final phase of the Order Process 2 workflow: the Order Shipping phase.

step.title: Enter Tracking Number and Ship
step.para: In the Order Shipping section of the Store Manager portal, enter a tracking number and click Ship.
The server initiates a call to the customer confirming the order number, and the delivery date and time.

section.para: The order has now been processed, and is on its way to the customer. The Statistics section provides the updated overview of Inventory and Sales.

Experiment with the other workflows listed in the Order Management section of the Store Manager portal by placing a new customer order over $100.00. On the Store Manager portal, set the Process Management workflow to either ordermanagement1 or ordermanagement3, and note the differences regarding how the server interacts with the Store Manager and the Customer.
